author: matifalcone
title: ALDEA NFT - Community Marketplace
description: ALDEA, la primera DAO latinoamericana, no es actualmente autosuficiente para generar una tesorería que financie su propio crecimiento.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer (ALDEA) wants to continue to provide their services to the community and also be self-sustained. The company being the first Latin American DAO, is not self-sustaining. In order to do more for the community and expand catalyst work, they need funding for the work. According to their proposal, 2021 set the beginning of a journey towards bringing the Cardano blockchain processes and tools to the Latin American communities. This proposal addresses the challenge effectively.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team of experts make up the ALDEA core members, Fund 5 winner and FALCO SPO, and the proposal can be carried out successfully. The detailed plan mentioned that they want to kickstart a DAO treasure, the first idea was to put up an NFT sale. It is stated in the proposal that they want to use the treasure to fund proposals sent out by the community and also continue building the community's knowledge in the whole Cardano ecosystem.
Detailed plan mentioned NFT minting, NFT publishing, Improved UX/UI, Glassbox Treasure, Buy NFTs, Seller, Treasure, ALDEA NFT Market place fee. All these details make it possible for a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map is very clear showing 3 months of work. The details are very easy to understand. The KPIs showing number of transactions to be expected , number of different wallets, number of different collections, number of platform traffic, all make auditing effective. The budget is broken down well for easy  auditing. Good proposal recommended.

f6_assessments.q0:
This ALDEA proposal has one main objective: transform its existing NFT Sale website into a comprehensive NFT marketplace, that will be selfsustainable by Q2 2022.
This NFT Marketplace for LatAm can bring a lot of LatAm newcomers to Cardano blockchain. The purpose of this marketplace is to contribute to a DAO treasure, which will be mostly used to fund LatAm projects, like is is done by Project Catalyst. 
The proposal explains with many details where it comes from, and where it wants to go. The potential impact of this project on LatAm Community growth is clearly explained with appropriate Kpis : number of transaction generated, unique wallets using the platform etc. 
Funding this project will offer a community a way to grow by getting its own ability to fund other LatAm projects, Dapps and SPOs.
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The ALDEA team has proven a lot. It made several proposals in past Project Catalyst Funds 5 and 6, creating Aldea Wiki for example. The team has grown a community and contributes to develop the collective knowledge about Cardano in LatAm. Moreover, they are identified and provide evidence that they gather high skills to make the project successful. 
This team has also partnered with 
The functions to be developed for the platform are well defined, as well as the roadmap for the development.
f6_assessments.q2:
A detailed roadmap it provided, with what seems to me like an ambitious schedule: the project is to be released after 3 months. As said above, the proposal provides appropriate Kpis to measure the success of the platform, which the community will be able to monitor.
The budget breakdown, detailed and relevant, gives further auditability to the project.
I strongly agree that the community will be able to monitor the progress of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Given though ALDEA NFT Marketplace could become the first Latin American Cardano NFT marketplace, the proposal clearly assess the challenge, by creating a space in which local artists and community members can mint and buy/sell NFTs. IMO, Since ALDEA already have a growing community base that supports the project's vision (proven by their NFT's sales which helps to raise over 7,800 ADA for the DAO's treasury in a couple weeks), these members will be more prone to utilize its marketplace instead of others options available to support the funding of the DAO's long term self-sustainability.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the wide team expertise and their proven involvement within Cardano's hispanic community, I think there's a really good chance they'll be able to deliver a fully functional and innovative NFT Marketplace. However, the proposal budget only address the technical side of the marketplace, and it doesn't take into account how they'll manage the business relationships side, to attract NFTs artists from local communities or Cardano/Crypto space, who will bring their artwork into the platform. They've said the marketing of the NFT is addressed in another separate proposal, but this might impose a risk for the successful growth of the marketplace, since if they don't receive both fundings, the marketplace will lack of a marketing/business growth budget to bring desirable artpieces to its platform.
f6_assessments.q2:
Technical information, Roadmap and KPIs are being provided by the team, so there's a clear path to success for this proposal.
Since the problem solution is to achieve DAO's self-sustainability by providing a service to the community who will eventually fill the DAO's treasury, it'll be good to enhance even more its auditability to know more about percentages of each fee described above, to see how much of those fees will go to the treasury, and how much of them will go to "platform support and investment". 
However, it's understandable if they don't have every little aspect designed yet, but it'll be good to have at least some approximates. And the idea of making treasury funds visible it's a good sign of their trasnparency's committements

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal effectively adheres to this challenge metrics of success, encouraging the creation of Spanish-language communities around Cardano.

An NFT marketplace oriented to the Latin community can become an important hub of activity, as it revolves around one of the most popular trends in crypto, serving as a meeting point for network enthusiasts, finding on this website (developed with Fund5 funds) resources that encourage learning and the development of valuable skills for the Cardano ecosystem, as well as a space where a community continues to develop steadily.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal has a high probability of being successfully implemented, as it has a previous framework (in the form of the ALDEA-DAO website) as well as a detailed and realistic roadmap. The team already has a track record working with the Cardano community and being proponents of initiatives that promote knowledge and information in Spanish language, about Cardano, blockchain and crypto in general.

An element that adds value is the inclusion of diagrams that clearly exemplify the expected operation of the marketplace, since they help outsiders to better capture the scope that this proposal seeks

On the other hand, a critical component for the success of such an initiative is proper marketing and exposure through the right media.
It is clear to me that marketing efforts are being concentrated in a separate proposal (I will do my best to advise this proposal as well) but in case this proposal obtains funding and the marketing proposal does not, the budget expressed here would not be enough to cover this important point, thus compromising the success of the initiative, at least in the medium term. 
Therefore, based on the information contained in this proposal alone, I rate feasibility with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team provides clear metrics that measure the success of this project, however i would suggest that it would be appropriate to establish standard parameters to consider a successful implementation, based on benchmarks with other platforms of the ecosystem that are already developed (for example CNFT.IO)
At the same time, the activity generated by the marketplace could allow a better understanding of the gap that must be overcome in order to match the platforms that capture most of the traffic.
On the other hand, it would be very useful if the risks that this project may face were listed here, as well as the actions that could mitigate them.

I believe that if this proposal is implemented successfully, it can serve as a parameter (taking into account all the components of ALDEA) to measure the engagement that the Latin American community generates with the Cardano ecosystem over time, with respect to the communities with greater participation. such as the North American and European ones.

solution: El Mercado NFT de ALDEA es el primer caso de uso de la prestación de un servicio a la comunidad al tiempo que se intenta lograr la autosostenibilidad.
experience: Miembros del equipo central de ALDEA, ganadores del Fondo5, FALCO SPO.
